definition: to violate/to offend/to assault/criminal/crime/to make a mistake/recurrence (of mistake or sth bad)

sentences.english: We should thus subordinate the prevention of first offences to the prevention of recidivism .
sentences.chinese: 這樣一來，我們便會讓預防初犯屈從於預防累犯。

sentences.english: They should be probated for first offenses.
sentences.chinese: 他們是初犯，應當緩刑處理。

sentences.english: Fines are as much as 260 Swiss francs - and that for a first offense.
sentences.chinese: 罰款高達260瑞士法郎，而這還只是初犯的金額。

sentences.english: She'll get away with a fine as it is a first offence.
sentences.chinese: 由於是初犯，她將被從輕發落，只罰款了事。

sentences.english: The police won't arrest him for a first offence.
sentences.chinese: 因是初犯，警察不會逮捕他。

sentences.english: First time offenders can expect leniency whereas repeat offenders can expect severe punishment.
sentences.chinese: 初犯會從寬處理，而慣犯會受到嚴厲的懲罰。

sentences.english: The warden believes in segregation of first offenders from hardened criminals.
sentences.chinese: 監獄看守員認爲得隔離初犯與累犯者。

definition: to repeatedly commit an offense/repeat offender/habitual criminal/recidivist/recidivism
to assess punishment/to determine the sentence (on a criminal)
to give oneself up/to surrender (to the authorities)
to admit to a crime/to plead guilty
